College_Summary: IIM Jammu is the youngest IIMs established in 2016. IIM Jammu was ranked 41st by NIRF 2023. IIM Jammu is known for its 2 year flagship MBA program, which offers admission through CAT. IIM Jammu cut-off is 94 percentile. But the candidates who have a score above 94 percentile have more chances of getting shortlisted for personal interview, through CAP.

College_Summary: Jammu University is a UGC-approved state university situated in Jammu. Established in 1969, Jammu University is accredited by NAAC with an 'A+' grade. Moreover, NIRF has ranked Jammu University at #63 among the universities in 2023. Moreover, NAAC

Model Institute of Engineering and Technology (MIET), Jammu was founded in 1996. MIET is part of the 88-year legacy of the MIER Group which has been in existence since 1936. Permanently Affiliated to University of Jammu and approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). MIET is accredited with an ‘A’ grade by NAAC and NBA Accreditation. Recognized for its excellence, MIET has garnered a 3.5-star rating from the Institute's Innovation Council under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, consistently leading in innovation within Jammu and Kashmir over the last three years.

College_Summary: SMVDU is ranked 101th among the engineering institutions and among Top-20 architecture schools by NIRF 2022. SMVDU offers various courses in UG, PG and Doctoral courses, such as BTech, BArch, BA, MA, MSc, MTech, MBA etc. SMVDU, Faculty of Management has two constituent departments: the School of Business & the School of Economics. School of Business offers PG courses like MBA and five-year Integrated MBA with BBA Honours. The university also offers a five-year Integrated MSc Economics course and PhD in Economics, the faculty of Humanities & Social Science consists of the School of Philosophy & Culture, School of Language & Literature. Check SMVDU Admissions

College_Summary: The Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology (SKUAST) of Kashmir is among the best agricultural universities in the country. The university offers numerous courses in various disciplines of agricultural science such as Agronomy, Entomology, Genetics & Plant Breeding, Plant Pathology, Seed Science & technology, etc. Admission to the courses is entrance-based. Interested students are required to apply online by paying the required application fee. Also, there are many scholarships for students such as Merit Scholarship, Student Welfare Fund, Post Matric Scholarship, etc.

College_Summary: NIT Srinagar is ranked 66 by NIRF 2022 in the engineering category. Established in 1960, NIT Srinagar offers undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral degrees. NIT Srinagar is one of the 31 National Institutes of Technology (NITs) and, as such, is directly controlled by the Ministry of Education (MoE).

College_Summary: IIT Jammu is a 3rd generation IIT established under the ‘Institutes of Technology Act’. The 400-acre, lush-green Jagti campus of IIT Jammu is located 25 acres closer to Trikuta hills. The institute has 100+ faculty members and 650+ students enrolled across its BTech, MTech, and PhD degrees. IIT Jammu BTech is the most popular course at IIT Jammu, where admissions are based on JEE Advanced scores followed by JoSAA counseling. The cutoff for BTech admissions typically ranges between 4856-17296. The course, which spans four years, costs approximately INR 10.6 lakhs. Other, popular programs of IIT Jammu include MTech and PhD degrees. Check: IIT Jammu Admission

College_Summary: The Government College of Engineering and Technology was established in 1994. The institution is affiliated to the University of Jammu and is approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). It offers various undergraduate level courses in engineering such as a Civil, Mechanica, Compute, Electrical, etc. Admission is based on entrance tests conducted by the state. Placement opportunities in this college are pretty decent, with companies like Hindustan Construction Co., Tata TeleServices, Tata Consultancy Services, Power Grid, and many more.

College_Name: Islamic University of Science and Technology
College_Summary: Islamic University of Science and Technology was established in 2005 and is recognized by UGC and accredited by NAAC. The University offers UG, PG, Diploma and PhD programmes in numerous specializations. The admissions in different courses are merit and entrance based. The university conducts its own entrance exam for various courses and other exams accepted are JEE Mains/GATE/CMAT. The NIRF ranked the university at #151 position among top Universities in India.

Courses_Details.Course Name: Bachelor of Business Administration [BBA] + Master of Business Administration [MBA]

College_Summary: SSM College of Engineering and Technology is a private engineering college established in the year 1998 in the Kashmir valley. It is affiliated to the University of Kashmir and has been approved by AICTE. The college offers B.E across 5 specializations, BBA at the UG level, MCA, M.Tech, MBA at the PG level, and also Diploma in Engineering programs. There is a strong team of teaching staff having academic excellence. It has an ideal infrastructure with all facilities of teaching/learning.

College_Name: Yogananda College of Engineering & Technology -[YCET], Jammu
College_Summary: Yogananda College of Engineering & Technology (YCET) is an AICTE(All India Council for Technical Education) approved self-financed institution. YCET is located at Gurha Brahmana (Patoli), Akhnoor Road, Jammu, about 8 kms from Jammu General Bus Stand. One of the top institutions in the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir(as per J&K Reorganization Act, 201) is well recognized by the Government of India and is affiliated to the University of Jammu.

It is presently running undergraduate courses in the fields of Arts, Science, and Computer applications.

JIAR is approved by the Central Council of Indian Medicine and Ministry of AYUSH, Government of India, New Delhi.

College_Summary: KC Law College is a private-sector college, located in Jammu, which was established in 2003. The college offers two courses across 1 stream i.e, a 5-year BA LLB and a 3-year LLB degree program. The basic eligibility for BA LLB and LLB courses is 10+2 with 45% aggregate marks in 10+2. Candidates need to apply online for Jammu University Entrance offline Test (JUET) and they must have to score at least 30% marks in JUET to be eligible for admission. However, the final merit is made in which 25% preference is given to JUET and 75% preference is given to candidates’ qualifying examination. JUET consists of 150 objective-type questions of 1 mark each and the duration of the entrance test is 2 hours and 30 minutes. Check KC Law College Admission

College_Name: Acharya Shri Chander College of Medical Sciences, Jammu
College_Summary: Government Medical College (GMC), Srinagar is the first medical college of Jammu & Kashmir and is one of the oldest medical colleges in North India. GMC Srinagar was established in the year of 1959 and has an existence of 54 Years. GMC Srinagar has emerged as a premier medical college in India and is affiliated with the University of Kashmir. MBBS, MD/ MS/ DNB, and PG Diploma are the courses offered by GMC Srinagar at the UG and PG levels. The college also offers DrNB and M.Ch at the Super Specialty level.

Sher-i-Kashmir Institute of Medical Sciences was established in the year 1982. It is the largest medical institution in the Indian Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir. Approved by the Medical Council of India, the institute provides various UG, PG, Doctoral, Post-Doctoral, and Diploma courses across various domains of Nursing and Medical Sciences. Admission to its courses is based on the rank secured by the candidate in the entrance exams. The institute is also running a hospital known as SKIMS Hospital which strives to be the leader in providing quality services to the people.

College_Summary: Central University of Kashmir, popularly known as CU Kashmir and formerly known as Central University of Jammu and Kashmir is a government university located in Srinagar, Kashmir. Established in 2009, the main campus of university is located in Tulmulla. CU Kashmir offers more than 40 UG, PG, PG Diploma, Research, and Vocational programs.

College_Summary: University of Kashmir, popularly known as Kashmir University, is one of the most prestigious universities in India. The university is re-accredited with an ‘A+’ grade by the NAAC. Kashmir University has been ranked 33rd among the top universities in India by NIRF 2023. The main campus of Kashmir University is spread over 247 acres of land and divided into three parts – Hazratbal Campus, Naseem Bagh Campus, and Mirza Bagh Campus. It is one of the largest universities in India with 12 faculties, 47 academic departments, and 21 centres. Kashmir University has 45 affiliated institutes and 21 constituent colleges falling under its umbrella. Check Kashmir University Affiliated Colleges

College_Summary: Jammu College of Physiotherapy was established in 2002 in Jammu of Jammu and Kashmir. It is a deemed institute of Physiotherapy in the state of Jammu and Kashmir and is the only college that is providing services in the field of physiotherapy in the state. It is established under the Shri Sain Charitable Trust for Higher Education and Research.

It is a public college and accredited ‘A’ grade by NAAC. The college is recognized by the state government of Jammu and Kashmir and is affiliated to University of Jammu, Jammu and Kashmir.

College_Summary: Islamia College of Science and Commerce was established in 1961 by the state government of Jammu and Kashmir. The college is accredited at A level with a grade of 3.27. It is affiliated to the University of Kashmir. The college provides courses in science and management studies at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Admission to the courses is done on the basis of marks secured in the previous qualifying examination.

National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT) Srinagar was established by the ministry of textile, India in 1995. NIFT, Srinagar offers only UG courses i.e B.Des in Fashion Communication and Fashion Design. The selection of the candidates is entrance based. The application mode is online.

College_Summary: Sri Pratap College, Srinagar is the oldest institute for higher secondary education in Jammu and Kashmir. The college is approved by UGC and affiliated to Cluster University Srinagar (CUS). It is also accredited with ‘Grade A’ by NAAC.

Courses_Details.Course Name: Bachelor of Science [B.Sc] + Master of Science [M.Sc] (Information Technology)

College_Summary: Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology of Jammu (SKUAST), is a state university established in the year 1999. It is affiliated to the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR). The university offers a variety of UG, PG, Ph.D., Diploma, and Certificate courses in the field of Agriculture, Horticulture, Forestry, Fisheries, Veterinary and Animal Sciences, and other allied sciences. Admission to most of the courses is done based on the CET conducted by the University.

The Directorate of Distance Education is accredited with ‘A’ grade by NAAC. It is affiliated to the University of Jammu. The college offers UG course, Pg course, Diplomaswith multiple specializations under every course in distance education. Admission to these courses is merit-based. Applicants seeking admission to the institute may apply online. The college is well equipped with various facilities like auditoriums, hostels, gymnasium, cafeteria, health center, post office, and many more. It is located in the new main campus of the University of Jammu.

Courses_Details.Course Name: Post Graduate Diploma in Business Management [PGDBM]

College_Summary: Kashmir Government Polytechnic (KGP) got established with 3 diploma courses in civil, electrical, and mechanical engineering. The earlier campus was in Naseem Bagh but the present campus is in Gogjibagh. The college is affiliated to The Jammu and Kashmir State Board of Technical Education (JKSBOTE) and is approved by the All-India Council of Technical Education (AICTE). Presently, the college offers 8 diploma courses and a few short-term courses in various disciplines of engineering. The admission is based on merit in secondary school examination marks and ranking/ cut off in the Board of Professional Entrance Examination (BPEE).

Cluster University of Jammu is a public state university established in 2016. It is a cluster of five colleges in Jammu city. This University provides Undergraduate courses and integrated courses under various specializations. Admissions are done on the basis of the university-level entrance exam i.e. CLUJET (Cluster University of Jammu Entrance Test).

Courses_Details.Course Name: Bachelor of Science [B.Sc] + Master of Science [M.Sc]

College_Summary: Cluster University of Srinagar, established in 2016, is located in Srinagar city of Jammu and Kashmir. There are multiple courses offered by the University at the Undergraduate and graduate levels in different fields including Engineering, Science, Humanities and Liberal Arts, Commerce and Management and Education. All the courses are available at different colleges of the University.

College_Summary: The Central Institute of Buddhist Studies (CIBS), formerly known as the School of Buddhist Philosophy, is accredited with ‘A’ grade by NAAC. The institute is one of the top-rated centers for Buddhist Studies in India. CIBS operates under the administrative charge of the Ministry of Culture, Govt. of India. The institute awards Degrees and Diplomas in Buddhist Philosophy, Literature, Traditional Arts, Astrology and Medicines.

It has an affiliation with the J&K State Board of Technical Education. This institute is approved by AICTE. The admission process is entrance-based only by accepting ranking secured in the J&K Polytechnic exam (PET) scores after a counselling process.
